column4: My external hard drive, formatted to NTFS, frequently encounters I/O errors while copying large amounts of data. the instructions in the error message tell me to run chkdsk /f in windows, and then reboot twice

what is the function of rebooting twice? I've found that failing to do so leaves the drive broken to linux. also, is there any way I could increase the survivability of the drive, while writing to it from linux? It seems to encounter an I/O error after about 4 gigs have been transferred to it.
The 2 reboots is to do with the ntfs log, I think. The first one fixes the errors, but doesn't write to the log that the drive is "clean". The second does that.
Also, I'd imagine the I/O errors are a hardware problem.
